intro: Arabis sieberi, commonly known as Siberian rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Arabis sieberi is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to tolerate harsh conditions.
